headline: Beijing to Restrict Plastics  Polluting Land and Water
abstract: Though likely to be welcomed by many Chinese who worry about pollution, the measures could be a hard sell for a society used to convenience.
lead_paragraph: BEIJING — It’s piled up in landfills. It clutters fields and rivers, dangles from trees, and forms flotillas of waste in the seas. China’s use of plastic bags, containers and cutlery has become one of its most stubborn and ugliest environmental blights.
